name: Vinaigrette & Hot Sauce Variety Pack
description: This variety pack was meticulously crafted to cater to both Team Sweet & Savory and Team Sweet Heat enthusiasts. Why settle for just one flavor when you can savor the best of both worlds? This thoughtfully curated variety pack combines two exceptional products, the Date Balsamic Vinaigrette (13 oz) and Sweet Date Hot Sauce (8 oz). The hot sauce is a harmonious blend of smooth sweetness and bold five pepper blend of heat. The marinade serves as a unique blend that transcends the ordinary, allowing you to elevate salads, caprese salad, brussels sprouts, salmon, chicken, steak, and pork to gourmet heights.

name: Pasta 101
description: The best starter kit to become a real pasta master! This box features two types of pasta, three divine sauces, and a gorgeous olive oil. The Mancini spaghetti marry beautifully with the basil pesto from Genova while the Eliche of Gragnano with their signature twisty shape can take on a bolder affair with the arrabbiata sauce or the ricotta and pecorino cheese tomato sauce. Both are soulmates to the Frantoio d’Orazio extra virgin olive oil that they suggest to pour over your dish for an extra touch of gourmet!

name: Golden Pothos
description: Thinking about getting an air purifier? The Golden Pothos is just that. Also known as the money plant, Golden Pothos is known as one of the best plants for purifying the air in your home. This plant is not pet friendly, requires low effort to take care of, and needs low to high amounts of indirect sunlight. Simple Care Instructions: • Light: Thrives in bright, indirect light, but also tolerates low light. Avoid direct sunlight, which may burn the leaves. • Watering: Water when the top 1–2 inches of soil are dry. Be careful not to overwater—Pothos prefers slightly dry over soggy soil. • Temperature: Keep between 65–85°F (18–29°C). Avoid cold drafts and temperatures below 50°F (10°C). • Pet Safety: NOT pet-friendly - Pothos is toxic to cats and dogs if ingested. Keep out of reach of pets.

name: Red Anthurium
description: This ruby red beauty, also known as the Flamingo Flower, struts its glossy green leaves and deep red buds through the South American jungle and into your home. This unique little plant will bloom throughout the year with proper care, making it a gift year-round. Simple Care Instructions: * Light: Bright, indirect light (avoid direct sunlight). * Water: Water when the top inch of soil feels dry. Do not let it sit in water. * Temperature: Prefers 65–80°F (18–27°C). Keep away from cold drafts.
meta_description: Red Anthurium combines fruit and gourmet chocolate to redefine fruit. Think flowers, delicious foods and great gifts, think Fruit bouquets. name: Calathea Rattlesnake
description: Introducing the Calathea Rattlesnake! This unique plant is sure to shake up any space it's in, but what gives it its unique name is its red-ish and purple underside. By day, you're welcomed by it's vibrant green leaves, and by night, this plant's leaves will fold together revealing it's rattle-snake like colors- hence the name. But don't worry it won't bite. This plant requires moderate effort to take care of, needs high amounts of indirect sunlight, and is pet friendly. Simple Care Instructions: * Light: Place in bright, indirect light. Avoid direct sunlight, which can fade or scorch the leaves. * Watering: Keep the soil consistently moist but not soggy. Water when the top inch of soil feels dry. Use filtered or distilled water if possible, as Calatheas are sensitive to tap water chemicals. * Temperature: Keep in a warm room between 65-75°F (18–24°C). Avoid cold drafts or sudden temperature changes. * Pet Friendly: Yes! Calatheas are non-toxic to pets.
